column4: heya anyone awake who can help diagnose a problem (preferably somebody with higher level linux experiance or debugging)
my Dell studio 17" is just freezing randomly since installing 11.04 - reinstalled fresh and same problem, used both ubuntu and kubuntu
nothing in any error logs that i can see, terminals are open and gkrellm running, and it literally just freezes with no slow down or error messages
so anyone know of any bugs or problems or help on debugging?
i personally think its related to touchpad, never happens when im not using it. and usually happens when im using the touchpad
when it freezes, then you click on the touchpad button, are you able to resume normal operations
nope, nothing fixes it other than hard reset
freezing does not occur in previous ubuntu versions?  which versions have you tried?
nope it did not happen in previous versions. Only started with Natty. I am debating installing debian or an older ubuntu to take hardware out of the equation
sounds delicious.  im gonna go eat now.. made me hungry...
it was actually - nachos complete with bacon, sour cream, cheese, etc
yeah trying another kernel or distro or version would narrow it down
its the whole ass of backing it all up and reinstalling - im so lazy :)
yeah...  install on another partition (still need to backup)?  try liveCD?  liveUSB?
choose yes?  you mean the upgrade?   also doing a clean install (of 11.04) fixes some of the bugs.     lucky you have lots of hdd space on hand
on the 2nd install of kubuntu i opted 'yes' for encrypted home dirs, but ended up not being able to use some of my files due to long filenames
256chars is the limit, but if you have 36 chars and encrypt it, it makes it a whole lot longer, so reduces file name char limit
ah complexities... good to know, tnx for sharing
